## Staging and Committing

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
### **Staging:**

-   `git add`

-   Preparing and organizing files before they are permanently recorded in the repository's history
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### **Committing:**

-   `git commit -m "commit message"`

-   Saving the changes in the staged files to the repository's history, creating a permanent snapsho
:::
:::

::: fragment
![Source: [git-scm.com](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2)](../images/git-staging-diagram.png){width="500"}
:::

## Your questions from last week

::: fragment
- *How to enable copy-paste in git bash?*
Click Git Bash icon on the **top left corner**, and choose **options**, Go to **Keys menu** and enable Copy and Paste (Ctrl/Shift + Ins) option.
**Apply and Save.**
:::

::: fragment
- *How to find the Users folder on Windows?*
Use `~` or if pwd is at `/:` you can still use `cd C:`
:::

::: fragment
- *Are the Commands in the chapter obligative?*
No, they are examples
:::

::: fragment
- *Will we also learn about coding*
No, but next session about [Quarto](https://quarto.org), in which you are to free use e.g. R or Python
:::

::: fragment

- *What should the recipes folder look like?*
At least, a folder with `recipe.txt`inside with atleast one commit.
:::
